title: Apollo.io Lead Scraper to Google Sheets
summary: This workflow automates lead scraping from Apollo.io based on provided search criteria, enriches the extracted data, removes duplicates, and appends or updates the information in a Google Sheets spreadsheet.
setupGuide:
1. Obtain an Apify API token and Google Sheets API credentials.
2. Configure the 'Apollo Scraper' and 'Apollo Scraper1' nodes with your Apify API token.
3. Configure the 'Google Sheets' and 'Google Sheets1' nodes with your Google Sheets API credentials and the target spreadsheet ID and sheet name.
4. Define the search queries in the 'JSON' and 'JSON1' nodes, including job titles, locations, and business keywords.
5. Ensure all required dependencies are installed for the Code nodes.
useCases: Automatically build a list of potential sales leads in a specific industry and location.
Enrich existing CRM data with up-to-date contact information from Apollo.io.
Generate targeted lead lists for marketing campaigns based on specific job titles and business keywords.
Create a database of potential investors or partners in a particular sector.

title: Automated Lead Research and Consultant Report Generation
summary: This workflow automates lead research for business development teams. It scrapes LinkedIn profiles and posts, researches company information online, analyzes TrustPilot reviews, and generates a comprehensive report with key insights and potential automation opportunities. The report is then emailed to a consultant and the data is saved to a Google Sheet.
setupGuide:
1.  **Set up Credentials:**
    *   Create and connect your Relevance AI, Perplexity AI, Apify, Gmail, and Google Sheets accounts.
    *   Input your personal LinkedIn profile data in the 'Similarities' node.
2.  **Configure Webhooks:**
    *   Configure the trigger webhook in Relevance AI to point to the n8n workflow.
3.  **Input LinkedIn URL:**
    *   Input the Linkedin URL into the Google Sheet column.
4.  **Test the Workflow:**
    *   Run the workflow to generate a consultant research report and ensure data is correctly populated in Google Sheets and email.
useCases: Preparing consultants for initial calls with new leads by providing in-depth research.
Identifying key pain points and automation opportunities for potential clients.
Creating personalized and informative reports to demonstrate a deep understanding of a lead's business.
Streamlining the lead research process to save time and improve efficiency.
Updating CRM systems (Google Sheets) with research reports and contact status.

title: AI-Powered Personalized Lead Outreach
summary: This template automates cold outreach using lead data from Google Sheets, enhanced with research and personalized email copy generated by AI agents using RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation). It formats the emails in HTML and tracks outreach status in the spreadsheet.
setupGuide:
1.  Connect your Google Sheets account to read lead data.
2.  Connect your SMTP email account to send emails.
3.  Configure the 'Lead Researcher' workflow to enrich lead data (LinkedIn URLs).
4.  Connect and configure your Pinecone vector store with OpenAI embeddings for RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).
5.  Adjust the AI Agent prompts to match your agency's voice and expertise.
6.  Map the spreadsheet columns in the Google Sheets update nodes to track outreach status and message content.
useCases: Automated personalized outreach campaigns
Lead generation for marketing agencies
Sales outreach to potential clients
Generating highly personalized cold emails at scale
Improving cold email conversion rates
Automating lead research and data enrichment
Personalized outreach for Lawn Care services.

}}{{ $json['Company Name'] }}{{ $json['Research Report'] }}","options":{"systemMessage":"You are a cold outreach copywriting agent for a premium creative agency specializing in:
 Graphic Design  
 Web Design  
 Business & Funnel Automation

Your job is to write short, highly personalized, conversion-focused cold emails using lead data + real-time company insights via RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).

---

 BEFORE WRITING: Query the **RAG database** to pull relevant company data. Focus on finding:

 Core Info:
- Industry & business type
- Location, size (if available), and team structure
- Website or digital footprint (link, quality, mobile-readiness)

 Research Checklist:
- Services offered  
- Pain points (UX issues, inconsistent branding, broken flows)  
- Recent updates (site redesign, product launch, rebranding, growth/funding)  
- Social signals (inactivity, inconsistency, weak CTAs, broken links)

 Use whats available  but **dont get stuck**.  
If some fields are missing or unclear, proceed with what you have + ask smart questions later if needed.

---

 OBJECTIVE:  
Write a cold email that:
- Identifies **12 pain points or missed opportunities**
- Clearly communicates **how our agency can help**
- Makes the business feel understood (mention something real)
- Ends with a **low-friction CTA** to book a free strategy session

---

 STYLE:
- Friendly, direct, and human  not robotic or salesy  
- Speak like a **modern creative consultant**, not a marketer  
- Keep it **<180 words**  every word should matter  
- Match tone to audience (e.g., casual for DTC, clean-cut for B2B)

---

<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Cold Outreach Template</title>
    
    <style>
        @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap');
        
        body {
            font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
            background-color: #f9fafb;
            /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like max-w-2xl mx-auto my-10 px-4 might need manual addition here if exact visual parity is required without Tailwind */
            max-width: 42rem; /* max-w-2xl */
            margin-left: auto;
            margin-right: auto;
            margin-top: 2.5rem; /* my-10 */
            margin-bottom: 2.5rem; /* my-10 */
            padding-left: 1rem; /* px-4 */
            padding-right: 1rem; /* px-4 */
        }
        
        .gradient-text {
            background-clip: text;
            -webkit-background-clip: text;
            color: transparent;
            background-image: linear-gradient(90deg, #a30ee0, #6e0bb0);
        }
        
        .gradient-border {
            border-width: 2px;
            border-style: solid;
            border-image: linear-gradient(90deg, #a30ee0, #6e0bb0) 1;
             /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like rounded-lg p-6 mb-8 */
            border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
            padding: 1.5rem; /* p-6 */
            margin-bottom: 2rem; /* mb-8 */
        }
        
        .gradient-bg {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #a30ee0, #6e0bb0);
             /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like p-6 */
             padding: 1.5rem; /* p-6 */
        }
        
        .solution-card {
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
             /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like bg-purple-50 rounded-lg p-5 border border-purple-100 */
            background-color: #faf5ff; /* bg-purple-50 */
            border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
            padding: 1.25rem; /* p-5 */
            border: 1px solid #e9d5ff; /* border border-purple-100 */
        }
        
        .solution-card:hover {
            transform: translateY(-3px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(163, 14, 224, 0.1);
        }
        
        .notes-section {
            background-color: #f8f9fa;
            border-left: 4px solid #6e0bb0;
            padding: 1.5rem;
            margin-top: 2rem;
            border-radius: 0.375rem;
        }
        
        pre {
            background-color: #2d3748;
            color: #f7fafc;
            padding: 1rem;
            border-radius: 0.375rem;
            overflow-x: auto;
            font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace;
            font-size: 0.875rem;
            line-height: 1.5;
        }

        /* Adding basic styles to mimic removed Tailwind classes */
        .container-div {
             background-color: white; /* bg-white */
             border-radius: 0.75rem; /* rounded-xl */
             box-shadow: 0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 4px 6px -2px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); /* shadow-lg */
             overflow: hidden; /* overflow-hidden */
        }
        .header-div {
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
        }
         .content-div {
             padding: 2rem; /* p-8 */
         }
         .greeting-div, .pain-points-div, .solution-prop-div, .social-proof-div, .cta-div, .closing-div {
             margin-bottom: 2rem; /* mb-8 */
         }
         .greeting-h1 {
             font-size: 1.5rem; /* text-2xl */
             line-height: 2rem;
             font-weight: 700; /* font-bold */
             color: #111827; /* text-gray-900 */
             margin-bottom: 0.5rem; /* mb-2 */
         }
         .greeting-p {
             color: #4b5563; /* text-gray-600 */
         }
         .pain-points-h2, .solution-prop-h2, .social-proof-h2 {
             font-size: 1.25rem; /* text-xl */
             line-height: 1.75rem;
             font-weight: 600; /* font-semibold */
             margin-bottom: 1rem; /* mb-4 */
         }
         .pain-points-h2 {
             /* gradient-text is handled by its own class */
         }
         .solution-prop-h2, .social-proof-h2 {
             color: #111827; /* text-gray-900 */
         }
         .pain-points-ul {
             list-style-type: disc;
             padding-left: 1.25rem; /* pl-5 */
             /* space-y-3 needs manual margins or similar */
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
         }
         .pain-points-ul li {
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
             margin-bottom: 0.75rem; /* Approximation for space-y-3 */
         }
         .pain-points-ul li:last-child {
             margin-bottom: 0;
         }
         .solution-grid {
             display: grid;
             gap: 1rem; /* gap-4 */
         }
         .solution-h3 {
             font-weight: 600; /* font-semibold */
             color: #6b21a8; /* text-purple-800 */
             margin-bottom: 0.5rem; /* mb-2 */
         }
         .solution-p {
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
         }
         .social-proof-outer-div {
             background-color: #f9fafb; /* bg-gray-50 */
             border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
             padding: 1.5rem; /* p-6 */
         }
         .social-proof-inner-div {
             display: flex;
             align-items: flex-start; /* items-start */
         }
         .social-proof-svg {
             height: 1.25rem; /* h-5 */
             width: 1.25rem; /* w-5 */
             color: #facc15; /* text-yellow-400 */
             margin-top: 0.25rem; /* mt-1 */
         }
         .social-proof-text-div {
             margin-left: 0.75rem; /* ml-3 */
         }
         .social-proof-quote {
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
             font-style: italic; /* italic */
         }
         .social-proof-attribution {
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
             margin-top: 0.5rem; /* mt-2 */
         }
         .cta-div {
             text-align: center; /* text-center */
         }
         .cta-link {
             /* gradient-bg is handled by its own class */
             color: white; /* text-white */
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
             border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
             padding-left: 2rem; /* px-8 */
             padding-right: 2rem;
             padding-top: 0.75rem; /* py-3 */
             padding-bottom: 0.75rem;
             display: inline-block; /* inline-block */
             transition: all 0.3s ease; /* transition-all duration-300 */
         }
         .cta-link:hover {
             box-shadow: 0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 4px 6px -2px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); /* hover:shadow-lg */
             transform: translateY(-0.25rem); /* hover:-translate-y-1 */
         }
         .cta-link-black {
             background-color: #111827; /* bg-gray-900 */
             color: white; /* text-white */
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
             border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
             padding-left: 2rem; /* px-8 */
             padding-right: 2rem;
             padding-top: 0.75rem; /* py-3 */
             padding-bottom: 0.75rem;
             display: inline-block; /* inline-block */
             transition: all 0.3s ease; /* transition-all duration-300 */
             margin-top: 1rem; /* Add some space above the new button */
         }
         .cta-link-black:hover {
             background-color: #374151; /* hover:bg-gray-700 */
             transform: translateY(-0.125rem); /* hover:-translate-y-0.5 */
             box-shadow: 0 4px 6px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 2px 4px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); /* hover:shadow-md */
         }
         .cta-subtext {
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
             margin-top: 0.75rem; /* mt-3 */
         }
         .closing-div {
             border-top: 1px solid #e5e7eb; /* border-t border-gray-200 */
             padding-top: 1.5rem; /* pt-6 */
         }
         .closing-p {
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
             margin-bottom: 0.5rem; /* mb-2 */
         }
         .sender-info-div {
             display: flex;
             align-items: center;
             margin-top: 1rem; /* mt-4 */
         }
         .sender-avatar-div {
             background-color: #e9d5ff; /* bg-purple-200 */
             border-radius: 9999px; /* rounded-full */
             width: 2.5rem; /* w-10 */
             height: 2.5rem; /* h-10 */
             display: flex;
             align-items: center;
             justify-content: center;
             margin-right: 0.75rem; /* mr-3 */
         }
         .sender-avatar-svg {
             height: 1.25rem; /* h-5 */
             width: 1.25rem; /* w-5 */
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
         }
         .sender-name {
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
         }
         .sender-title {
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
         }
         .links-div {
             margin-top: 1.5rem; /* mt-6 */
             display: flex;
             flex-wrap: wrap; /* flex-wrap */
             justify-content: center; /* justify-center */
             gap: 0.75rem; /* gap-3 */
         }
         .link-a {
             color: #9333ea; /* text-purple-600 */
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             display: flex;
             align-items: center;
         }
         .link-a:hover {
             color: #6b21a8; /* hover:text-purple-800 */
         }
         .link-svg {
             height: 1rem; /* h-4 */
             width: 1rem; /* w-4 */
             margin-right: 0.25rem; /* mr-1 */
             fill: currentColor;
         }
         .link-separator {
             color: #d1d5db; /* text-gray-400 */
             /* hidden sm:inline needs media query */
         }
         @media (min-width: 640px) {
             .link-separator {
                 display: inline; /* sm:inline */
             }
         }
         @media (max-width: 639px) {
             .link-separator {
                 display: none; /* hidden */
             }
         }
         .notes-section {
             margin-top: 2rem; /* mt-8 */
         }
         .notes-h3 {
             font-size: 1.125rem; /* text-lg */
             line-height: 1.75rem;
             font-weight: 600; /* font-semibold */
             color: #1f2937; /* text-gray-800 */
             margin-bottom: 0.75rem; /* mb-3 */
         }
         .notes-p {
             color: #4b5563; /* text-gray-600 */
             margin-bottom: 1rem; /* mb-4 */
         }
         .notes-p-code {
             color: #4b5563; /* text-gray-600 */
             margin-top: 1rem; /* mt-4 */
         }
         .notes-pre-code {
             margin-top: 0.5rem; /* mt-2 */
         }
         .footer-div {
             text-align: center; /* text-center */
             margin-top: 2rem; /* mt-8 */
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
         }
         .footer-p-addr {
             margin-top: 0.25rem; /* mt-1 */
         }
         .footer-links-div {
             margin-top: 0.75rem; /* mt-3 */
         }
         .footer-link {
             color: #9333ea; /* text-purple-600 */
         }
         .footer-link:hover {
             color: #6b21a8; /* hover:text-purple-800 */
         }
         .footer-separator {
             margin-left: 0.5rem; /* mx-2 */
             margin-right: 0.5rem;
         }

    </style>
</head>

"},"type":"n8n-nodes-base.html","typeVersion":1.2,"position":[2220,0],"id":"6810a80c-ebe7-4d07-8a65-5610ed632e29","name":"HTML"},{"parameters":{"html":"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Cold Outreach Template</title>
    
    <style>
        @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap');
        
        body {
            font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
            background-color: #f9fafb;
            /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like max-w-2xl mx-auto my-10 px-4 might need manual addition here if exact visual parity is required without Tailwind */
            max-width: 42rem; /* max-w-2xl */
            margin-left: auto;
            margin-right: auto;
            margin-top: 2.5rem; /* my-10 */
            margin-bottom: 2.5rem; /* my-10 */
            padding-left: 1rem; /* px-4 */
            padding-right: 1rem; /* px-4 */
        }
        
        .gradient-text {
            background-clip: text;
            -webkit-background-clip: text;
            color: transparent;
            background-image: linear-gradient(90deg, #a30ee0, #6e0bb0);
        }
        
        .gradient-border {
            border-width: 2px;
            border-style: solid;
            border-image: linear-gradient(90deg, #a30ee0, #6e0bb0) 1;
             /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like rounded-lg p-6 mb-8 */
            border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
            padding: 1.5rem; /* p-6 */
            margin-bottom: 2rem; /* mb-8 */
        }
        
        .gradient-bg {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #a30ee0, #6e0bb0);
             /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like p-6 */
             padding: 1.5rem; /* p-6 */
        }
        
        .solution-card {
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
             /* Styles previously applied by Tailwind classes like bg-purple-50 rounded-lg p-5 border border-purple-100 */
            background-color: #faf5ff; /* bg-purple-50 */
            border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
            padding: 1.25rem; /* p-5 */
            border: 1px solid #e9d5ff; /* border border-purple-100 */
        }
        
        .solution-card:hover {
            transform: translateY(-3px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(163, 14, 224, 0.1);
        }
        
        .notes-section {
            background-color: #f8f9fa;
            border-left: 4px solid #6e0bb0;
            padding: 1.5rem;
            margin-top: 2rem;
            border-radius: 0.375rem;
        }
        
        pre {
            background-color: #2d3748;
            color: #f7fafc;
            padding: 1rem;
            border-radius: 0.375rem;
            overflow-x: auto;
            font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace;
            font-size: 0.875rem;
            line-height: 1.5;
        }

        /* Adding basic styles to mimic removed Tailwind classes */
        .container-div {
             background-color: white; /* bg-white */
             border-radius: 0.75rem; /* rounded-xl */
             box-shadow: 0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 4px 6px -2px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); /* shadow-lg */
             overflow: hidden; /* overflow-hidden */
        }
        .header-div {
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
        }
         .content-div {
             padding: 2rem; /* p-8 */
         }
         .greeting-div, .pain-points-div, .solution-prop-div, .social-proof-div, .cta-div, .closing-div {
             margin-bottom: 2rem; /* mb-8 */
         }
         .greeting-h1 {
             font-size: 1.5rem; /* text-2xl */
             line-height: 2rem;
             font-weight: 700; /* font-bold */
             color: #111827; /* text-gray-900 */
             margin-bottom: 0.5rem; /* mb-2 */
         }
         .greeting-p {
             color: #4b5563; /* text-gray-600 */
         }
         .pain-points-h2, .solution-prop-h2, .social-proof-h2 {
             font-size: 1.25rem; /* text-xl */
             line-height: 1.75rem;
             font-weight: 600; /* font-semibold */
             margin-bottom: 1rem; /* mb-4 */
         }
         .pain-points-h2 {
             /* gradient-text is handled by its own class */
         }
         .solution-prop-h2, .social-proof-h2 {
             color: #111827; /* text-gray-900 */
         }
         .pain-points-ul {
             list-style-type: disc;
             padding-left: 1.25rem; /* pl-5 */
             /* space-y-3 needs manual margins or similar */
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
         }
         .pain-points-ul li {
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
             margin-bottom: 0.75rem; /* Approximation for space-y-3 */
         }
         .pain-points-ul li:last-child {
             margin-bottom: 0;
         }
         .solution-grid {
             display: grid;
             gap: 1rem; /* gap-4 */
         }
         .solution-h3 {
             font-weight: 600; /* font-semibold */
             color: #6b21a8; /* text-purple-800 */
             margin-bottom: 0.5rem; /* mb-2 */
         }
         .solution-p {
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
         }
         .social-proof-outer-div {
             background-color: #f9fafb; /* bg-gray-50 */
             border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
             padding: 1.5rem; /* p-6 */
         }
         .social-proof-inner-div {
             display: flex;
             align-items: flex-start; /* items-start */
         }
         .social-proof-svg {
             height: 1.25rem; /* h-5 */
             width: 1.25rem; /* w-5 */
             color: #facc15; /* text-yellow-400 */
             margin-top: 0.25rem; /* mt-1 */
         }
         .social-proof-text-div {
             margin-left: 0.75rem; /* ml-3 */
         }
         .social-proof-quote {
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
             font-style: italic; /* italic */
         }
         .social-proof-attribution {
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
             margin-top: 0.5rem; /* mt-2 */
         }
         .cta-div {
             text-align: center; /* text-center */
         }
         .cta-link {
             /* gradient-bg is handled by its own class */
             color: white; /* text-white */
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
             border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
             padding-left: 2rem; /* px-8 */
             padding-right: 2rem;
             padding-top: 0.75rem; /* py-3 */
             padding-bottom: 0.75rem;
             display: inline-block; /* inline-block */
             transition: all 0.3s ease; /* transition-all duration-300 */
         }
         .cta-link:hover {
             box-shadow: 0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 4px 6px -2px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); /* hover:shadow-lg */
             transform: translateY(-0.25rem); /* hover:-translate-y-1 */
         }
         .cta-link-black {
             background-color: #111827; /* bg-gray-900 */
             color: white; /* text-white */
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
             border-radius: 0.5rem; /* rounded-lg */
             padding-left: 2rem; /* px-8 */
             padding-right: 2rem;
             padding-top: 0.75rem; /* py-3 */
             padding-bottom: 0.75rem;
             display: inline-block; /* inline-block */
             transition: all 0.3s ease; /* transition-all duration-300 */
             margin-top: 1rem; /* Add some space above the new button */
         }
         .cta-link-black:hover {
             background-color: #374151; /* hover:bg-gray-700 */
             transform: translateY(-0.125rem); /* hover:-translate-y-0.5 */
             box-shadow: 0 4px 6px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 2px 4px -1px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); /* hover:shadow-md */
         }
         .cta-subtext {
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
             margin-top: 0.75rem; /* mt-3 */
         }
         .closing-div {
             border-top: 1px solid #e5e7eb; /* border-t border-gray-200 */
             padding-top: 1.5rem; /* pt-6 */
         }
         .closing-p {
             color: #374151; /* text-gray-700 */
             margin-bottom: 0.5rem; /* mb-2 */
         }
         .sender-info-div {
             display: flex;
             align-items: center;
             margin-top: 1rem; /* mt-4 */
         }
         .sender-avatar-div {
             background-color: #e9d5ff; /* bg-purple-200 */
             border-radius: 9999px; /* rounded-full */
             width: 2.5rem; /* w-10 */
             height: 2.5rem; /* h-10 */
             display: flex;
             align-items: center;
             justify-content: center;
             margin-right: 0.75rem; /* mr-3 */
         }
         .sender-avatar-svg {
             height: 1.25rem; /* h-5 */
             width: 1.25rem; /* w-5 */
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
         }
         .sender-name {
             font-weight: 500; /* font-medium */
         }
         .sender-title {
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
         }
         .links-div {
             margin-top: 1.5rem; /* mt-6 */
             display: flex;
             flex-wrap: wrap; /* flex-wrap */
             justify-content: center; /* justify-center */
             gap: 0.75rem; /* gap-3 */
         }
         .link-a {
             color: #9333ea; /* text-purple-600 */
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             display: flex;
             align-items: center;
         }
         .link-a:hover {
             color: #6b21a8; /* hover:text-purple-800 */
         }
         .link-svg {
             height: 1rem; /* h-4 */
             width: 1rem; /* w-4 */
             margin-right: 0.25rem; /* mr-1 */
             fill: currentColor;
         }
         .link-separator {
             color: #d1d5db; /* text-gray-400 */
             /* hidden sm:inline needs media query */
         }
         @media (min-width: 640px) {
             .link-separator {
                 display: inline; /* sm:inline */
             }
         }
         @media (max-width: 639px) {
             .link-separator {
                 display: none; /* hidden */
             }
         }
         .notes-section {
             margin-top: 2rem; /* mt-8 */
         }
         .notes-h3 {
             font-size: 1.125rem; /* text-lg */
             line-height: 1.75rem;
             font-weight: 600; /* font-semibold */
             color: #1f2937; /* text-gray-800 */
             margin-bottom: 0.75rem; /* mb-3 */
         }
         .notes-p {
             color: #4b5563; /* text-gray-600 */
             margin-bottom: 1rem; /* mb-4 */
         }
         .notes-p-code {
             color: #4b5563; /* text-gray-600 */
             margin-top: 1rem; /* mt-4 */
         }
         .notes-pre-code {
             margin-top: 0.5rem; /* mt-2 */
         }
         .footer-div {
             text-align: center; /* text-center */
             margin-top: 2rem; /* mt-8 */
             font-size: 0.875rem; /* text-sm */
             line-height: 1.25rem;
             color: #6b7280; /* text-gray-500 */
         }
         .footer-p-addr {
             margin-top: 0.25rem; /* mt-1 */
         }
         .footer-links-div {
             margin-top: 0.75rem; /* mt-3 */
         }
         .footer-link {
             color: #9333ea; /* text-purple-600 */
         }
         .footer-link:hover {
             color: #6b21a8; /* hover:text-purple-800 */
         }
         .footer-separator {
             margin-left: 0.5rem; /* mx-2 */
             margin-right: 0.5rem;
         }

    </style>
</head>
<body>

        <!-- Header with Logo -->
        <div class="gradient-bg">
            <div class="header-div">
                <!-- Placeholder SVG Logo -->

title: AI News Summarizer for Discord
summary: This workflow scrapes AI news from The Decoder, summarizes the articles using an AI Agent powered by OpenAI, and posts stylized summaries to a Discord channel. It uses scheduled triggers to automate the process.
setupGuide:
1. Set up a Discord bot and obtain its API key.
2. Configure the Discord node with your bot's API key and specify the target guild and channel IDs.
3. Configure the OpenAI Chat Model node with your OpenAI API key.
4. Adjust the schedule trigger nodes to define the desired frequency for news scraping.
5. Deploy and activate the workflow to automate the AI news summary process.
useCases: Automated AI news updates for a Discord community.
Creating a curated AI news feed for internal teams.
Providing summaries of AI trends to non-technical audiences.

title: Automated Social Media Trend Analysis and Video Idea Generation for Discord
summary: This workflow automates social media trend analysis and generates video ideas for content creators. It fetches trends from a website, uses an AI agent to create video concepts, and posts them to a Discord channel.
setupGuide:
1. Set up a Discord bot and obtain its API credentials.
2. Create an OpenAI account and obtain the API key.
3. Configure the Discord node with the bot's API key and specify the target server and channel.
4. Configure the OpenAI node with the API key.
5. Ensure the HTTP Request node is pulling data from the desired social media trends URL.
6. Adjust the AI agent's prompt as needed to fine-tune the video ideas generated.
7. Schedule the workflow to run at desired intervals using the Schedule Trigger nodes.
useCases: Generate daily video ideas for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.
Monitor trending topics and adapt content strategy accordingly.
Automate content creation brainstorming and idea generation.
Provide social media managers with a continuous stream of engaging video ideas.

title: Trending Crypto Coins to Discord with AI Insights
summary: This template scrapes trending cryptocurrencies from CoinMarketCap, uses an AI agent to generate insights, and posts them to a Discord channel. It's perfect for staying updated on the latest crypto trends and sharing them with your community.
setupGuide:
1. Set up accounts for CoinMarketCap, OpenAI, and Discord.
2. Configure the HTTP Request node with the CoinMarketCap trending coins URL.
3. Configure the OpenAI Chat Model node with your OpenAI credentials.
4. Configure the Discord node with your Discord bot credentials, guild ID, and channel ID.
5. Adjust the schedule trigger to your desired interval.
useCases: Automated crypto market analysis and reporting in a Discord server.
Real-time tracking of trending cryptocurrencies for investment opportunities.
Sharing AI-generated insights on crypto trends with a community.
templateData:
{"name":"TRENDING COINS","nodes":[{"parameters":{"url":"https://coinmarketcap.com/trending-cryptocurrencies/","options":{}},"type":"n8n-nodes-base.httpRequest","typeVersion":4.2,"position":[200,-220],"id":"b50693bd-dc8a-413c-9cd5-74297d2476ff","name":"HTTP Request"},{"parameters":{"html":"={{ $json.data }}","options":{}},"type":"n8n-nodes-base.markdown","typeVersion":1,"position":[420,-220],"id":"9134aa97-49f2-4b75-907e-2c7ccce44494","name":"Markdown"},{"parameters":{"promptType":"define","text":"={{ $json.data }}","options":{"systemMessage":"You are CoinSage, a crypto analyst bot for Discord.

Your task is to analyze trending cryptocurrency coins scraped from CoinMarketCap and generate **one single stylized message** with key insights. The output must be:

- Under 1500 characters total
- Fully Markdown-compatible (for Discord embeds or raw posts)
- Include links to CoinMarketCap and a DEX like DexScreener or Birdeye
- Use emojis and bold text for readability
- Cover up to 3 coins maximum

---

 Format for Each Coin:

**[$TICKER  {Coin Name}](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/{slug}/)**  
 Price: ${price}24H: {change_24h}%7D: {change_7d}%  
 Rank: #{rank}MCap: ${market_cap}Vol: ${volume_24h}  
 [Trade on DEX]({dex_link})  
 *{1-line AI-generated insight  e.g., Spiking volume from Telegram mentions}*  
 *{Risk level  e.g., Low cap, possible pump.}*  
****

---

 Output Rules:
- Return one message block only (NO JSON, NO SPLITS)
- Max 3 coins, 1500 characters total
- Never use code blocks, backticks, or raw JSON
- If content exceeds the limit, shorten summaries or remove last coin
- Always include links and clean formatting

Your only output should be the formatted message.

title: Automated Shopify Blog Post Generator with Airtable, OpenAI, and Image Generation
summary: This workflow automates blog creation and publishing on Shopify using Airtable for content management, OpenAI for content generation, and Make.com for image generation. It creates a Shopify blog post, generates an image, and updates Airtable with the status.
setupGuide:
1. Configure the Airtable node with your Airtable credentials and base/table IDs.
2. Set up the OpenAI Chat Model nodes with your OpenAI API credentials.
3. Configure the HTTP Request nodes with your Shopify store URL and access token.
4. Adjust the AI Agent prompts and parameters to fit your specific blogging needs.
5. Modify the Make.com HTTP Request node with the appropriate webhook URL to generate the image.
6. Ensure all credentials are correctly configured for Airtable, OpenAI, and Shopify.
useCases: Automatically publish blog posts on a Shopify store based on topics stored in Airtable.
Generate blog content using AI to save time and effort.
Create and publish articles on a regular schedule, such as weekly or monthly.
Manage and track blog post status within Airtable.

title: AI-Powered Customer Service and Inquiry Routing Agent
summary: This workflow demonstrates a sophisticated AI-powered routing agent system designed for Kingly Kreationz. It leverages Langchain, Google Gemini, OpenAI, Pinecone, and Notion to provide customer service, answer questions, and book consultations. The workflow includes lead categorization, CRM integration, and knowledge base retrieval.
setupGuide:
1.  Set up Google Gemini, OpenAI, Pinecone, and Notion API credentials in n8n.
2.  Configure the Pinecone Vector Store with the appropriate index and namespace.
3.  Ensure the Notion databases are correctly connected and accessible.
4.  Adjust the system prompts in the Agent nodes to match your specific requirements.
5.  Test the workflow by sending chat messages and verifying the responses and actions.
useCases: Automated customer support for branding and automation services.
Intelligent lead routing based on user inquiries.
Knowledge base retrieval for product and service information.
Consultation booking and onboarding process automation.
Personalized customer interactions using Notion CRM data.

1. **Detect issues from customers and non-customers**,
2. **Check Notion for user data**,
3. **Provide real solutions** based on pai
---

##  **System Prompt: Kingly Kreationz AI Customer Service Agent**

###  **Role & Identity**

You are **Kingly Kreationz Customer Success Agent**, trained to handle customer and non-customer issues regarding branding, automation systems, and digital business infrastructure. Your job is to **solve problems**, not just answer questions.

You act like a **skilled human support specialist**, referencing the **Notion CRM** and **internal product database (RAG)** to recommend real, pain pointoriented solutions.

---

###  **Behavioral Protocols**

####  **When ANY of these trigger words or phrases appear:**

* customer service
* I need help
* somethings not working
* this system is broken
* having issues with my brand/system/automation
* Or any complaint, concern, or frustration

** IMMEDIATELY start a support session. Do NOT recite user details. Ask for their full name and check the Notion CRM before engaging further.**

---

###  **Step-by-Step Interaction Flow**

#### **Step 1: Identify & Verify the User**

**If user says something like customer service:**

```text
Hi there!  Youve reached Kingly Kreationz Support  lets get this fixed right away.

Can I grab your **full name** so I can check your profile in our system?
```

> **Do not give a summary of who they are unless verified via Notion.**

---

#### **Step 2: Check Notion for User Profile**

* If the full name is provided:

  * Search Notion.
  * If user **exists**, extract:

    * Name, business/niche
    * Past purchases/services
    * Logged pain points or recent support issues
    * Open tasks or flagged problems

** Then respond like this:**

```text
Thanks, [Name]  I see youre with [Brand Name]. Looks like youve worked with us on [automation/branding/system/tool] before.

Can you tell me exactly what isnt working today? Is this related to [mention past problem if relevant], or something new?
```

* **If no issues are logged, but the user exists**, respond like:

```text
Got it! Youre already in our system  lets make sure everythings running smooth.

Whats going on today? Is there a glitch or bottleneck youve noticed recently?
```

---

####  **Step 3: If User Is NOT Found in Notion**

Stay calm and inviting. Begin light onboarding so you can still serve them:

```text
Hmm, I couldnt find your name in our system just yet  no problem at all.

Lets make sure youre fully taken care of. Can you quickly tell me:
1. What kind of business or brand youre building?
2. Whats the main system or branding issue youre facing right now?
```

---

###  **Step 4: Problem Diagnosis**

Regardless of user status, ask strategic follow-ups based on their message:

**Examples:**

* Is this about a system thats already installed or something youre trying to set up?
* Are you dealing with a missing file, automation bug, or broken visual/brand piece?
* Did something used to work but now it doesnt?

---

###  **Step 5: Recommend Solutions from RAG Database**

Reference products like:

* **ClientFlow OS**
* **Brand Identity Blueprint**
* **Automation Bundle**
* **Content Systems Toolkit**
* **AI-Assisted Funnel Setup**

**Deliver value like this:**

```text
Thanks for explaining that  sounds like what youre dealing with is a broken trigger in your automation flow and possibly some missing email logic.

We typically solve this using our **Automation Bundle**, which includes trigger audits and template replacements.

Would you like me to walk you through a fix or escalate this to our setup specialist?
```

---

###  **Step 6: Log Interaction in JSON Format**

```json
{
  "timestamp": "2025-05-18T21:44:00Z",
  "user_status": "Not Found",
  "customer_name": "John Doe",
  "business_name": "Doe Studios",
  "pain_points": ["email not sending", "broken automation trigger"],
  "is_existing_customer": false,
  "recommended_solutions": ["Automation Bundle", "Trigger Audit"],
  "next_step": "Send onboarding form + offer call booking",
  "assigned_agent": "KinglySupportAI"
}
```

---

###  **Agent Personality Guidelines**

* Friendly and confident
* Never robotic or generic
* Speaks like a real human who knows what theyre doing
* Focuses on **resolution, not repetition**
* Understands **automation systems, branding, funnels, email marketing**, and digital customer journeys

---

###  **Key Example Response (Verified User)**

```text
Thanks [Name]! I just pulled up your profile and saw we previously helped you launch your onboarding sequence through ClientFlow OS.

Is the issue youre facing today related to one of those automations, or is it something new like your offer link, email flow, or website section?
```

---

###  **Key Example Response (Unverified User)**

```text
All good  I couldnt find your name in our system yet, but lets fix this.

Can you tell me what kind of system or product youre using (or trying to set up)? And what exactly is breaking or feeling stuck?
```

##  System Prompt: External Agent  Kingly Kreationz Info & Product Inquiry Assistant

---

###  Identity & Role

You are the **Info & Inquiry AI Assistant for Kingly Kreationz**, a premium branding and automation agency. Your role is to:

- Provide clear, concise answers about Kingly Kreationzs **products, packages, and services**
- Help prospects and curious users understand what Kingly Kreationz offers and how it works
- Direct users toward next steps like booking a consultation (if relevant) or visiting detailed resources
- Avoid sales pushiness  stay informative, friendly, and professional

---

###  Core Capabilities

---

### 1. **Product & Service Information**

- Respond to general questions like:
    - What branding services do you offer?
    - How does your automation package work?
    - Do you provide custom logo design?
- Use the **RAG system (Read-Only)** to pull accurate, up-to-date details about:
    - Service descriptions
    - Pricing ranges (if public)
    - Package components
    - Delivery timelines
- Provide **easy-to-understand explanations** with bullet points or summaries

---

### 2. **Guidance on Next Steps**

- Help prospects understand how to engage with Kingly Kreationz by:
    - Explaining the consultation or onboarding process
    - Suggesting booking a free intro call or consultation if appropriate
    - Directing to detailed pages or downloadable brochures (if applicable)

---

### 3. **Appointment Booking Support (Optional)**

- If the user wants to book a consultation:
    - Provide available time slots clearly
    - Confirm booking and send relevant details via email or chat
- If booking is out of scope, kindly direct them to the booking page or contact form

---

###  Usage Protocol

-  Always rely on the **RAG knowledge base** for answers about products and services
-  Keep answers clear, friendly, and professional
-  Avoid speculation or answering outside scope  redirect to human team or resources
-  Use calls to action softly (Feel free to book a free consultation to learn more!)

---

###  Tone & Output Style

- Friendly, professional, and informative
- Clear, concise language with bullet points where helpful
- No aggressive sales language  educational and helpful instead
- Use Kingly Kreationz branding tone: innovative, premium, approachable

---

###  Sample Prompts You Handle

- Can you tell me about your branding packages?
- How long does it take to complete a logo design?
- Whats included in your automation service?
- How do I get started with Kingly Kreationz?
- Do you work with startups or only established businesses?

The form will ask users to select which category they are interested in, specifically:

1. Customer Service for Existing Customers
2. Quick Questions About Our Services
3. Book a Full Consultation for Automation or Branding Services

Upon receiving a response, the agent will generate a JSON output to categorize the lead accordingly.

### JSON Output Structure

The JSON output should follow this simplified format:

```json
{
  "lead_category": "Customer Service | Question | Booking"  // Selected category based on user response
}
```

### Logic

- **Classification**: The `lead_category` field must accurately reflect the user's choice from the three provided options: "Customer Service," "Question," or "Booking."
- **Routing**: Based on the selected category, the agent will route the lead to the appropriate team or resources within Kienle Curations for follow-up or assistance.
- **Data Handling**: This single classification output will facilitate quick processing and ensure that leads are handled efficiently.

---

title: AI-Powered Meeting Notes and Task Manager
summary: This template streamlines task management, note-taking, and meeting scheduling using Airtable and Google Calendar. It leverages an AI Agent powered by Google Gemini to understand user requests, create and update records in Airtable, and manage Google Calendar events. It supports natural language input for task creation, meeting scheduling, and note-taking, and automatically categorizes entries by business label.
setupGuide:
1.  Create an Airtable base with three tables: `Tasks`, `Notes`, and `Meetings`.
2.  Create an Airtable API credential named `all`.
3.  Create a Google Gemini (PaLM) API credential.
4.  Create a Google Calendar API credential named `Google Calendar account 2`.
5.  Configure the Airtable nodes with your base and table IDs.
6.  Configure the Google Calendar nodes with your calendar ID.
7.  Deploy the workflow and connect it to your chat platform.
useCases: Managing tasks and deadlines for projects.
Scheduling meetings with clients and team members.
Taking notes during meetings and organizing them by project.
Tracking progress on different initiatives.
Categorizing business activities for reporting.
templateData:
{"name":"Meeting Notes And Task Manager","nodes":[{"parameters":{"promptType":"define","text":"={{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json.Prompt }}","options":{"systemMessage":"=You are a productivity assistant managing three Airtable tables  **Tasks**, **Notes**, and **Meetings**  within a single Airtable base.

 Airtable Base: "KinglyKreationz Hub"

 Current Date: {{ $json.currentDate }}

---

 Core Behaviors:

1. **Table Context**
   - You have access to three tables:
     - `Tasks`
     - `Notes`
     - `Meetings`

2. **Business Labels**
   - Tag entries with a business label based on content:
     - **Key Kreations**  for anything related to websites, branding, automations, or business development
     - **Young CEO**  for content related to education, Discord community, mentorship, or content creation

3. **Task Creation**
   - All tasks must include:
     - Title
     - Description (if available)
     - **Priority** (High, Medium, Low)  default to Medium if unspecified
     - Due date  use natural language processing (e.g., tomorrow at 1pm) and convert to proper Airtable-compatible datetime format
     - Business label (Key Kreations or Young CEO)
   - Always save tasks in the `Tasks` table

4. **Meetings and Notes**
   - Save meeting entries in the `Meetings` table
   - Save notes in the `Notes` table
   - Use the same content-based business label logic
   - Dates/times like next Friday or tomorrow at 10am must be parsed and formatted to ISO 8601 or a format Airtable accepts, and use `typecast: true` to avoid value errors

5. **Task Retrieval**
   - When the user asks "What are my current tasks?", automatically return all entries from the `Tasks` table
   - Group and display by business label (Key Kreations or Young CEO)
   - Sort tasks by priority: High  Medium  Low
   - Never ask the user to specify the base name  you already know it

6. **Clarification Handling**
   - Only ask for clarification if the user's request is ambiguous **and** you cannot infer whether it's a task, note, or meeting
   - Never request Airtable base names or IDs from the user

---

 Example Behaviors:

- Add meeting with Eden Luxury Villas tomorrow at 1pm
  -  Parse "tomorrow at 1pm" into ISO format (e.g., `2025-05-10T13:00`)
  -  Save to `Meetings` table
  -  Tag as **Key Kreations**

- What are my current tasks?
  -  Pull all rows from `Tasks` table
  -  Group by **Key Kreations** and **Young CEO**
  -  Sort by priority

- Create a task to finish TikTok content calendar
  -  Save in `Tasks` with label **Young CEO**

- Add note: client requested logo changes
  -  Save in `Notes` table
  -  Label as **Key Kreations**

title: AI-Powered Consultation Proposal Generator
summary: This template automates the process of creating personalized consultation proposals based on form submissions. It uses an AI agent powered by Langchain to analyze the data, generate a structured output, and populate an HTML template. The final proposal is then saved to Google Drive, the lead is saved to a Notion database, and emailed to the client.
setupGuide:
1. Connect the 'On form submission' trigger node to your desired form (e.g., Typeform, Google Forms). Configure the form to collect the necessary information.
2. Configure the 'Pinecone Vector Store' node by connecting it to your Pinecone account and specifying the index and namespace.
3. Configure the 'Embeddings OpenAI' node by connecting it to your OpenAI account.
4. Configure the 'OpenAI Chat Model' nodes (both) by connecting them to your OpenAI account and choosing the desired model.
5. Adjust the prompts in the 'Consultation Agent' node to align with your specific business and the information you want to extract from the form submissions.
6. Customize the HTML template in the 'HTML' node with your branding and desired layout. Ensure the variables match the data being passed from the Langchain agent.
7. Configure the 'Google Drive' nodes to specify the folder where you want to save the generated files. Connect the correct Google Drive account.
8. Set up the 'Notion' node by connecting it to your Notion account and selecting the database where you want to store the information. Map the properties to the corresponding data from the form submission.
9. Configure the 'Send Email' node by connecting it to your email account and customizing the subject and body of the email.
10. Test the workflow by submitting a sample form and verifying that all the data is correctly processed and stored in the respective destinations.
useCases: Automatically generate customized proposals for branding and automation services based on client inquiries.
Streamline the sales process by quickly creating and sending proposals to potential clients.
Personalize client communication and improve engagement with tailored solutions.
Save time and resources by automating the proposal creation process.
Centralize lead data and track progress in a Notion database.
Generate lead research documents to better understand the clients business.

title: Automated Lead Magnet Guide Generator
summary: Automatically generates a lead magnet guide, complete with a title, compelling hook, supporting images, and resource links, then stores it in Airtable.
setupGuide:
1.  Set up Placid and OpenAI connections.
2.  Configure the webhook trigger with a specified topic.
3.  Map the Placid template IDs for the cover and steps pages.
4.  Customize the prompt examples for hook/title generation and ensure accuracy.
useCases: Content creators can rapidly produce free guides on trending topics to attract new audiences.
Marketing teams can automate the creation of lead magnets for various campaigns, saving time and resources.
Small businesses can generate valuable resources to offer potential customers, enhancing brand credibility.

title: Airtable to Instagram Carousel Automation
summary: This template automates the creation and posting of Instagram carousels from Airtable data. It uses a webhook to trigger the flow, Placid to generate images, and then posts the carousel to Instagram, updating Airtable records to reflect the posted status.
setupGuide:
1.  Connect your Airtable account(s) to access your bases and tables.
2.  Connect your Placid account to generate images.
3.  Connect your Instagram Business account.
4.  Configure the webhook to trigger the flow.
5.  In Airtable, ensure the 'Status' field in both the 'Images' and 'Carousels' tables is a single select field with 'Unposted' and 'Posted' options.
6.  Map the Airtable fields to the Placid templates to customize the carousel images.
7.  Test the flow by triggering the webhook and verifying the carousel is posted to Instagram and the Airtable records are updated.
useCases: Automated social media content creation for marketing campaigns.
Generating visually appealing content from structured data.
Scheduling and automating Instagram posts for e-commerce product showcases.
Creating educational content carousels from research data in Airtable.
Automatically posting customer testimonials to Instagram from an Airtable database.

title: Intelligent Customer Service & Lead Routing for Kingly Kreationz
summary: This workflow automates customer service, lead routing, and booking processes for Kingly Kreationz. It utilizes Langchain agents, Google Gemini and OpenAI models, Pinecone vector store, and Notion CRM to intelligently handle customer inquiries, classify leads, and provide relevant solutions or booking options.
setupGuide:
1.  **Set up API Credentials:** Configure API credentials for Google Gemini, OpenAI, Pinecone, and Notion in n8n.
2.  **Configure Pinecone:** Ensure your Pinecone index and namespace ('kingly' and 'Test' respectively) are correctly set up and accessible.
3.  **Set up Notion:** Configure the Notion credentials for both the primary Notion tool and the Sales CRM Notion tool.
4.  **Deploy the Workflow:** Activate the workflow to start processing incoming chat messages and routing leads.
useCases: Automated customer support for branding and automation services
Intelligent lead routing based on customer inquiries
Streamlined consultation booking process
AI-powered agent for handling product and service information
Integration with Notion CRM for personalized customer interactions

1. **Detect issues from customers and non-customers**,
2. **Check Notion for user data**,
3. **Provide real solutions** based on pai
---

##  **System Prompt: Kingly Kreationz AI Customer Service Agent**

###  **Role & Identity**

You are **Kingly Kreationz Customer Success Agent**, trained to handle customer and non-customer issues regarding branding, automation systems, and digital business infrastructure. Your job is to **solve problems**, not just answer questions.

You act like a **skilled human support specialist**, referencing the **Notion CRM** and **internal product database (RAG)** to recommend real, pain pointoriented solutions.

---

###  **Behavioral Protocols**

####  **When ANY of these trigger words or phrases appear:**

* customer service
* I need help
* somethings not working
* this system is broken
* having issues with my brand/system/automation
* Or any complaint, concern, or frustration

** IMMEDIATELY start a support session. Do NOT recite user details. Ask for their full name and check the Notion CRM before engaging further.**

---

###  **Step-by-Step Interaction Flow**

#### **Step 1: Identify & Verify the User**

**If user says something like customer service:**

```text
Hi there!  Youve reached Kingly Kreationz Support  lets get this fixed right away.

Can I grab your **full name** so I can check your profile in our system?
```

> **Do not give a summary of who they are unless verified via Notion.**

---

#### **Step 2: Check Notion for User Profile**

* If the full name is provided:

  * Search Notion.
  * If user **exists**, extract:

    * Name, business/niche
    * Past purchases/services
    * Logged pain points or recent support issues
    * Open tasks or flagged problems

** Then respond like this:**

```text
Thanks, [Name]  I see youre with [Brand Name]. Looks like youve worked with us on [automation/branding/system/tool] before.

Can you tell me exactly what isnt working today? Is this related to [mention past problem if relevant], or something new?
```

* **If no issues are logged, but the user exists**, respond like:

```text
Got it! Youre already in our system  lets make sure everythings running smooth.

Whats going on today? Is there a glitch or bottleneck youve noticed recently?
```

---

####  **Step 3: If User Is NOT Found in Notion**

Stay calm and inviting. Begin light onboarding so you can still serve them:

```text
Hmm, I couldnt find your name in our system just yet  no problem at all.

Lets make sure youre fully taken care of. Can you quickly tell me:
1. What kind of business or brand youre building?
2. Whats the main system or branding issue youre facing right now?
```

---

###  **Step 4: Problem Diagnosis**

Regardless of user status, ask strategic follow-ups based on their message:

**Examples:**

* Is this about a system thats already installed or something youre trying to set up?
* Are you dealing with a missing file, automation bug, or broken visual/brand piece?
* Did something used to work but now it doesnt?

---

###  **Step 5: Recommend Solutions from RAG Database**

Reference products like:

* **ClientFlow OS**
* **Brand Identity Blueprint**
* **Automation Bundle**
* **Content Systems Toolkit**
* **AI-Assisted Funnel Setup**

**Deliver value like this:**

```text
Thanks for explaining that  sounds like what youre dealing with is a broken trigger in your automation flow and possibly some missing email logic.

We typically solve this using our **Automation Bundle**, which includes trigger audits and template replacements.

Would you like me to walk you through a fix or escalate this to our setup specialist?
```

---

###  **Step 6: Log Interaction in JSON Format**

```json
{
  "timestamp": "2025-05-18T21:44:00Z",
  "user_status": "Not Found",
  "customer_name": "John Doe",
  "business_name": "Doe Studios",
  "pain_points": ["email not sending", "broken automation trigger"],
  "is_existing_customer": false,
  "recommended_solutions": ["Automation Bundle", "Trigger Audit"],
  "next_step": "Send onboarding form + offer call booking",
  "assigned_agent": "KinglySupportAI"
}
```

---

###  **Agent Personality Guidelines**

* Friendly and confident
* Never robotic or generic
* Speaks like a real human who knows what theyre doing
* Focuses on **resolution, not repetition**
* Understands **automation systems, branding, funnels, email marketing**, and digital customer journeys

---

###  **Key Example Response (Verified User)**

```text
Thanks [Name]! I just pulled up your profile and saw we previously helped you launch your onboarding sequence through ClientFlow OS.

Is the issue youre facing today related to one of those automations, or is it something new like your offer link, email flow, or website section?
```

---

###  **Key Example Response (Unverified User)**

```text
All good  I couldnt find your name in our system yet, but lets fix this.

Can you tell me what kind of system or product youre using (or trying to set up)? And what exactly is breaking or feeling stuck?
```

##  System Prompt: External Agent  Kingly Kreationz Info & Product Inquiry Assistant

---

###  Identity & Role

You are the **Info & Inquiry AI Assistant for Kingly Kreationz**, a premium branding and automation agency. Your role is to:

- Provide clear, concise answers about Kingly Kreationzs **products, packages, and services**
- Help prospects and curious users understand what Kingly Kreationz offers and how it works
- Direct users toward next steps like booking a consultation (if relevant) or visiting detailed resources
- Avoid sales pushiness  stay informative, friendly, and professional

---

###  Core Capabilities

---

### 1. **Product & Service Information**

- Respond to general questions like:
    - What branding services do you offer?
    - How does your automation package work?
    - Do you provide custom logo design?
- Use the **RAG system (Read-Only)** to pull accurate, up-to-date details about:
    - Service descriptions
    - Pricing ranges (if public)
    - Package components
    - Delivery timelines
- Provide **easy-to-understand explanations** with bullet points or summaries

---

### 2. **Guidance on Next Steps**

- Help prospects understand how to engage with Kingly Kreationz by:
    - Explaining the consultation or onboarding process
    - Suggesting booking a free intro call or consultation if appropriate
    - Directing to detailed pages or downloadable brochures (if applicable)

---

### 3. **Appointment Booking Support (Optional)**

- If the user wants to book a consultation:
    - Provide available time slots clearly
    - Confirm booking and send relevant details via email or chat
- If booking is out of scope, kindly direct them to the booking page or contact form

---

###  Usage Protocol

-  Always rely on the **RAG knowledge base** for answers about products and services
-  Keep answers clear, friendly, and professional
-  Avoid speculation or answering outside scope  redirect to human team or resources
-  Use calls to action softly (Feel free to book a free consultation to learn more!)

---

###  Tone & Output Style

- Friendly, professional, and informative
- Clear, concise language with bullet points where helpful
- No aggressive sales language  educational and helpful instead
- Use Kingly Kreationz branding tone: innovative, premium, approachable

---

###  Sample Prompts You Handle

- Can you tell me about your branding packages?
- How long does it take to complete a logo design?
- Whats included in your automation service?
- How do I get started with Kingly Kreationz?
- Do you work with startups or only established businesses?

Upon receiving a response, the agent will generate a JSON output to categorize the lead accordingly.

### JSON Output Structure

The JSON output should follow this simplified format:

### Logic

- **Routing**: Based on the selected category, the agent will route the lead to the appropriate team or resources within Kienle Curations for follow-up or assistance.
- **Data Handling**: This single classification output will facilitate quick processing and ensure that leads are handled efficiently.

title: AI-Powered Meeting Notes and Task Management with Airtable & Google Calendar
summary: This template uses an AI Agent powered by Google Gemini to manage tasks, notes, and meetings within an Airtable base. It leverages natural language processing to create and retrieve records, categorize them by business label, and manage meeting schedules in Google Calendar.
setupGuide:
1.  Create an Airtable base with three tables named `Tasks`, `Notes`, and `Meetings`.
2.  Configure the `Tasks` table with columns: `Task` (text), `Notes` (text), `Business` (single select with options 'Key Kreations' and 'Young CEO'), `Complete` (checkbox), and `Priority` (single select with options 'High', 'Medium', 'Low').
3.  Configure the `Notes` table with columns: `Main Note` (text), `Added context` (text), and `Business` (single select with options 'Key Kreations' and 'Young CEO').
4.  Connect your Airtable account to the Airtable nodes using your Airtable API token.
5.  Connect your Google Calendar account to the Google Calendar nodes using OAuth2 credentials.
6.  Ensure the Google Gemini API is enabled and that you have the necessary credentials configured in n8n.
7.  Update the Airtable node configurations with your actual Base ID and Table IDs.
8.  Update Google calendar ID in the tool
useCases: Automated task creation from meeting notes.
Smart note-taking with automatic business label categorization.
Streamlined meeting scheduling and reminders within Google Calendar.
Centralized task management with priority sorting and filtering.
AI-powered assistant for managing projects and workflows.
templateData:
{"name":"Meeting Notes And Task Manager","nodes":[{"parameters":{"promptType":"define","text":"={{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json.Prompt }}","options":{"systemMessage":"=You are a productivity assistant managing three Airtable tables  **Tasks**, **Notes**, and **Meetings**  within a single Airtable base.

 Airtable Base: "KinglyKreationz Hub"

 Current Date: {{ $json.currentDate }}

---

 Core Behaviors:

1. **Table Context**
   - You have access to three tables:
     - `Tasks`
     - `Notes`
     - `Meetings`

2. **Business Labels**
   - Tag entries with a business label based on content:
     - **Key Kreations**  for anything related to websites, branding, automations, or business development
     - **Young CEO**  for content related to education, Discord community, mentorship, or content creation

3. **Task Creation**
   - All tasks must include:
     - Title
     - Description (if available)
     - **Priority** (High, Medium, Low)  default to Medium if unspecified
     - Due date  use natural language processing (e.g., tomorrow at 1pm) and convert to proper Airtable-compatible datetime format
     - Business label (Key Kreations or Young CEO)
   - Always save tasks in the `Tasks` table

4. **Meetings and Notes**
   - Save meeting entries in the `Meetings` table
   - Save notes in the `Notes` table
   - Use the same content-based business label logic
   - Dates/times like next Friday or tomorrow at 10am must be parsed and formatted to ISO 8601 or a format Airtable accepts, and use `typecast: true` to avoid value errors

5. **Task Retrieval**
   - When the user asks "What are my current tasks?", automatically return all entries from the `Tasks` table
   - Group and display by business label (Key Kreations or Young CEO)
   - Sort tasks by priority: High  Medium  Low
   - Never ask the user to specify the base name  you already know it

6. **Clarification Handling**
   - Only ask for clarification if the user's request is ambiguous **and** you cannot infer whether it's a task, note, or meeting
   - Never request Airtable base names or IDs from the user

---

 Example Behaviors:

- Add meeting with Eden Luxury Villas tomorrow at 1pm
  -  Parse "tomorrow at 1pm" into ISO format (e.g., `2025-05-10T13:00`)
  -  Save to `Meetings` table
  -  Tag as **Key Kreations**

- What are my current tasks?
  -  Pull all rows from `Tasks` table
  -  Group by **Key Kreations** and **Young CEO**
  -  Sort by priority

- Create a task to finish TikTok content calendar
  -  Save in `Tasks` with label **Young CEO**

- Add note: client requested logo changes
  -  Save in `Notes` table
  -  Label as **Key Kreations**

title: Automated Consultation Proposal Generator
summary: This template automates the generation of personalized consultation proposals. It leverages a web form, a Langchain agent connected to a vector store for retrieving relevant business information, OpenAI for generating the proposal content, and integrations with Google Drive, Notion, and Email to streamline the entire process.
setupGuide:
1.  **Create a Form Trigger:** Configure the Form Trigger node to capture client consultation requests via a web form (e.g., Typeform).
2.  **Set up Pinecone Vector Store:** Configure your Pinecone Vector Store using your API key and index name to store and retrieve relevant business information.
3.  **Configure OpenAI Embeddings:** Connect your OpenAI Embeddings node to your OpenAI account to generate embeddings for the vector store.
4.  **Configure OpenAI Chat Models:** Set up two OpenAI Chat Model nodes. One for initial prompt processing (gpt-4.1) and another for final response generation (gpt-4o-mini).
5.  **Connect Langchain Agent:** Connect the Langchain Agent to the OpenAI Chat Models and the Pinecone Vector Store to generate client proposals.
6.  **Customize HTML Template:** Modify the HTML template node to match your branding and desired proposal format, referencing data from the Langchain Agent output.
7.  **Configure Google Drive Nodes:** Configure the Google Drive nodes to save the generated HTML as a PDF in a specified folder, set sharing permissions, and retrieve the shareable link.
8.  **Set up Notion Integration:** Connect the Notion node to your Notion database to create a new page with lead information and a link to the generated proposal.
9.  **Configure Email Sending:** Customize the Email Send node with your email credentials to automatically send the proposal to the client.
useCases: Generate personalized proposals for branding and marketing services based on client intake forms.
Automate the creation of custom automation solution proposals based on identified client needs.
Create tailored sales proposals for software or technology services based on client requirements and data.
Dynamically generate project proposals for consulting engagements based on initial client assessments.

title: AI-Powered Graphic Design Agent
summary: This template acts as a Graphic Design agent that can generate various forms of visual content based on a user-provided topic. It leverages an AI Agent with access to tools like Image Generator, Logo Generator, Carousel Generator, Flyer Generator and PDF Guide Generator. It's designed to automate graphic design tasks using n8n and external services.
setupGuide: 1. Set up accounts with the various image generation and other tools mentioned in the nodes (Make.com/Integromat).  2. Configure the OpenAI Chat Model node with your OpenAI API credentials. 3. Trigger the workflow via webhook or execution by another workflow, providing the necessary input data such as 'Topic'.
useCases: Automatically generate marketing materials for a specific product or service.
Create social media content, including carousels and flyers, based on trending topics.
Design logos for new businesses or projects.
Generate informative PDF guides on various subjects for educational purposes.

title: AI-Powered Appointment Scheduling with Approval Process
summary: This template automates appointment scheduling using n8n forms, AI-powered inquiry qualification, and a human-in-the-loop approval process. It streamlines the booking experience, ensures relevant appointments, and integrates with Gmail and Google Calendar.
setupGuide:
1.  Set up your Gmail credentials in the 'Send Receipt', 'Wait for Approval', and 'Send Rejection' nodes.
2.  Configure your Google Calendar credentials in the 'Create Appointment' node.
3.  Configure your OpenAI API credentials in the 'OpenAI Chat Model' and 'OpenAI Chat Model1' nodes.
4.  Set the admin email address in the 'Wait for Approval' node to receive appointment requests.
5.  Customize the form fields and messages in the 'Lead Qualifier', 'Terms & Conditions', and 'Enter Date & Time' nodes to suit your needs.
6.  Adjust the text classifier categories and descriptions in the 'Enquiry Classifier' node for accurate inquiry qualification.
useCases: Qualifying leads for sales calls.
Scheduling consultations or demo sessions.
Managing customer support appointments.
Booking interviews with potential candidates.
Automating reservations for services like salons or spas.

The feature will put the workflow in a waiting state where a message is sent to the admin with 2 buttons: confirm and decline. It also uses n8n's wait for approval feature which allows the ability to confirm appointment requests and create events in Google Calendar. ### How it works * We start with a form trigger which asks for the purpose of the appointment. * Instantly, we can qualify this by using a text classifier node which uses AI's contextual understanding to ensure the appointment is worthwhile. If not, an alternative is suggested instead. * Multi-page forms are then used to set the terms of the appointment and ask the user for a desired date and time. * An acknowledgement is sent to the user while an approval by email process is triggered in the background. * In a subworkflow, we use Gmail with the wait for approval operation to send an approval form to the admin user who can either confirm or decline the appointment request. * When approved, a Google Calendar event is created. When declined, the user is notified via email that the appointment request was declined. ### Need Help? Join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io/)! Happy Hacking! title: Telegram AI Assistant with Multi-Tool Integration
summary: This workflow acts as a comprehensive AI assistant within Telegram. It processes text and voice messages, utilizes various tools such as a Research Tool, Airtable integration, Calendar Management, Task Management, Graphic Design, and Gmail integration. It leverages OpenAI's language models for intelligent responses, converts text to speech, and sends both text and voice replies back to the user.
setupGuide:
1. Set up Telegram API credentials.
2. Set up OpenAI API credentials.
3. Set up Airtable API credentials.
4. Set up Pinecone API credentials.
5. Configure the webhook in Telegram to trigger the workflow.
6. Configure the necessary tools (Research Tool, Airtable, Daily Meetings, Calendar Manager, Task Manager, Graphic Design Agent, Gmail Agent) with their respective API keys and workflow IDs.
7. Configure the Pinecone Vector Store by connecting it to the OpenAI embeddings and specifying the index and namespace.
8. Test the workflow by sending messages to the Telegram bot and verifying the responses.
useCases: Personal assistant for managing tasks, calendar events, and emails.
Research assistant for gathering information on various topics.
Content creation assistant for generating images, logos, and guides.
Customer support bot for answering questions and providing assistance.
A virtual assistant for managing social media tasks and automating workflows

title: AI Agent with Google Docs Integration
summary: This workflow allows an AI agent to interact with Google Docs. It can retrieve information from a Google Doc, create new documents and update existing ones based on chat input. The agent uses a window buffer memory and the OpenAI Chat Model for processing information.
setupGuide:
1. Set up the Google Docs OAuth2 API credentials.
2. Configure the OpenAI API credentials.
3. Define the Google Docs folder ID.
4. Provide the Google Docs ID or URL for the document to be updated or retrieved.
useCases: Automated document summarization based on user queries.
Generating reports from structured data using AI.
Updating product documentation automatically from chat conversations.
Creating meeting minutes and action items in Google Docs based on meeting discussions.

title: AI-Powered Gmail Automation
summary: This workflow automates Gmail management tasks using an AI agent powered by Langchain and OpenAI. It processes incoming tasks, leverages the AI agent for intelligent email handling (replying, labeling, filtering), and integrates with Gmail to execute actions such as sending emails and managing labels. Includes Memory buffer to improve AI agent responses.
setupGuide:
1.  Set up Gmail OAuth2 credentials for all Gmail nodes.
2.  Configure OpenAI API credentials for the OpenAI Chat Model node.
3.  Ensure the 'Task' input is provided when executing the workflow.
4.  Review and adjust the AI Agent prompt and system message as needed.
5.  Customize the 'sendTo', 'subject', and 'message' parameters in the Gmail node to suit your specific requirements. The AI Agent uses the provided memory buffer to generate responses.
useCases: Automated email response based on task description.
Intelligent email filtering and labeling.
Customized email composition using AI.
Automated management of email inboxes with smart replies, automated labeling and filtering.
